document.masterDocTitle: The spiders of Québec: update, additions and corrections

Remark.— The numerous records from the boreal forest of Québec suggest that it may be locally common in conifer forests, especially among mosses and litter. Interestingly, most collections were done with Berlese extraction of litter. Other trapping methods in the same location were not as productive.
